item.title: Molly Ticehurst's former partner Daniel Billings pleads guilty to her murder
item.description: Daniel Billings pleads guilty to killing his former partner, Molly Ticehurst, at Forbes in central western New South Wales.

item.title: WA grazier accepts wild donkey cull order but refuses to pull the trigger himself
item.description: A WA pastoralist says he will not stand in the way of the bullets aimed at the donkeys on his remote property, but he will not kill the animals he says have had a positive environmental impact.

item.title: List of Canberra schools closed after asbestos found in recalled decorative coloured sand
item.description: The ACT has closed 16 public schools today, with several others partially closed due to potential asbestos exposure.

item.title: What we know about the coloured sand recalled from Officeworks, Woolworths over traces of asbestos
item.description: Fifteen public schools in Canberra are closed today, and several others are partially closed, due to potential asbestos contamination in coloured sand sold at dozens of stores across Australia. Here is what we know.

item.title: Hunter Valley wedding bus crash driver Brett Button loses appeal on 32-year jail sentence
item.description: The bus driver who crashed and killed 10 wedding guests while injuring 25 others in the NSW Hunter Valley has lost an appeal on the severity of his sentence.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu insists he won't seek pardon on corruption case after Donald Trump's letter
item.description: The Israeli PM says he will not push for a pardon or concede guilt in his long-running corruption trial, less than a day after thanking Donald Trump for urging Israel's president to clear his record.

item.title: Wallabies announces team to face Ireland in spring tour Test match, James O'Connor returns at fly-half
item.description: The Wallabies have recalled several big-name players for their penultimate Test of 2025, as coach Joe Schmidt returns to his old Irish stamping ground.

item.title: Medical waste destined for landfill diverted to wildlife charities in Victoria
item.description: A Victorian medical charity helps divert 15,000 tonnes of medical waste from landfill while giving wildlife carers the resources to nurse injured animals back to health.

item.title: Kai Trump, granddaughter of President Donald Trump, sits last in LPGA Tour debut
item.description: Kai Trump, teenage granddaughter of US President Donald Trump, has a rough start to The Annika tournament after receiving a sponsors invite to take part in the LPGA Tour event.

item.title: When is the 2025 AFL draft? Here's your guide to bidding, trades and the official pick order
item.description: Another AFL draft has arrived, offering dozens of teenage footballers the chance to realise their dreams. Here is everything you need to know.

item.title: Adelaide man Samuel Joe Frost faces lengthy sentence over child abuse offences
item.description: An Adelaide paedophile who posted images online "boasting" about his crimes has been sentenced to at least 14 years in prison. WARNING: This story contains details of sexual abuse that readers may find distressing.

item.title: Ex-Spanish football boss who kissed World Cup player gets egged during book launch
item.description: The former president of Spain's national football federation, who made headlines after his behaviour following the final of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, has had eggs thrown at him during the launch of his book.

item.title: Eliesa Katoa to be moved to Melbourne hospital as brain surgery recovery continues
item.description: NRL star Eliesa Katoa faces more time in hospital when he returns to Melbourne as he recovers from a brain bleed after playing for Tonga.

item.title: Daniel Billings threatened Molly Ticehurst days before her murder, court documents show
item.description: Court documents reveal shocking details about the murder of childcare worker Molly Ticehurst at the hands of her former partner in the NSW last year.

item.title: Lanlan Yang pleads not guilty over Rolls-Royce crash in Sydney
item.description: Lanlan Yang allegedly refused to take a breath test or give a version of events to police after a collision that left a person badly injured.

item.title: Michael Wilson pleads not guilty to rape, possessing child abuse material
item.description: Michael Simon Wilson has pleaded not guilty to more than 60 charges, including rape, and possessing and transmitting child abuse material.

item.title: SA Premier says he will prioritise saving Bedford over COP negotiations in Brazil
item.description: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas says he will "definitely not" go to Brazil for COP negotiations, and instead will prioritise saving disability employment provider Bedford.

item.title: The minimal-effort herbs and edible plants that produce for years
item.description: Fresh herbs can be expensive at the supermarket, but many perennial varieties are cheap and easy to grow at home.

item.title: Dementia now the leading cause of death nationwide, overtaking heart disease, new ABS data shows
item.description: New data on causes of death reveals more than 17,500 people died of dementia in 2024 nationwide, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: Illegal tobacco retailer hit with $1.5 million fine following record seizure in Queensland
item.description: The charges stemmed from a statewide crackdown on the illegal tobacco trade.

item.title: Bondi Sands the latest brand to recall sunscreens over potential SPF concerns
item.description: A major Australian sunscreen brand, Bondi Sands is the latest to announce recalls over potential SPF concerns, and the first to remove products from shelves that have not been identified as using the same problematic base formulation.

item.title: Seal escapes orca hunt by jumping onto photographer's boat
item.description: A wildlife photographer has captured the dramatic moment a seal eluded a pod of killer whales by scrambling onto the stern of her boat.

item.title: Seal seeks refuge on photographer's boat while fleeing orcas
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man who drove into floodwater in NSW central west sentenced over boy's death
item.description: A man has been sentenced to a one year intensive corrections order, to be served in the community, after attempting to drive through floodwater in the NSW central west, resulting in the death of a five-year-old.

item.title: NSW government workers' comp changes defeated as premier declares fight is 'over'
item.description: The Minns government has been unable to break an impasse after six months of trying to pass the legislation.

item.title: Police search Bega wetlands for knife used in fatal stabbing of Gordon Kessey
item.description: Police continue their investigation into the suspected murder of Gordon Kessey on the NSW far south coast, looking for a missing blade in nearby wetlands.

item.title: Accused Adass Israel Synagogue arsonist, Giovanni Laulu, granted bail in Melbourne court
item.description: Giovanni Laulu, a 21-year-old man accused of carrying out an attack that caused more than $20 million in damage to the Adass Israel Synagogue, is granted bail by a Melbourne magistrate.

item.title: 'Chaos situation' as potential asbestos exposure in coloured sand closes Canberra schools
item.description: A recall of children’s coloured sand after asbestos traces were found has led to the closure of multiple public schools in the ACT, leaving parents scrambling for care options and answers.

item.title: England hits out in Perth Ashes warm-up match as Joe Root misses out
item.description: England star Joe Root is yet to score a Test century in Australia and was out for one run despite the team's strong platform in the warm-up match.

item.title: Vanuatu flags expulsion of foreign advisers from government buildings as Nakamal Agreement hangs in balance
item.description: The move will affect Australia and New Zealand's multiple police and defence personnel working in Vanuatu, and could set back the signing of the Nakamal Agreement.

item.title: Major feed mill in the Northern Territory getting back on track after fire
item.description: A feed mill in the Northern Territory is getting back on track after a major fire destroyed more than $3 million of hay.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: What is a supercell storm and why are they so destructive?
item.description: Australia is in its peak severe weather system and there are warnings that supercell storms could hit the east coast this weekend. So what exactly is a supercell?

item.title: Jury in Rajwinder Singh trial taken through murdered woman Toyah Cordingley's phone data
item.description: A jury trial of former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh, who is charged with the Far North Queensland woman's 2018 murder, has heard details about Ms Cordingley's phone data from the afternoon she disappeared.

item.title: Australia earns Billie Jean King Cup victory over Portugal, Maya Joint and Kim Birrell claim wins
item.description: Australia got their Billie Jean King Cup play-off campaign to a successful start, with two straight sets singles victories over Portugal.

item.title: Tasmania's Lake St Clair confirmed as Australia's deepest with 3D mapping technology
item.description: Recent CSIRO research definitively places Tasmania's Lake St Clair at 163 metres deep, nearly twice the depth of Bass Strait.

item.title: Five Chinese tourists killed in minibus accident in Bali
item.description: Five Chinese tourists have been killed and eight others lightly injured in Bali after their rental minibus plunged into a shallow ravine, an official has said.

item.title: Meg Lanning hits 90* in 100th WBBL game as Stars down Scorchers by 16 runs, Strikers defeat Renegades
item.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning and South Africa batter Laura Wolvaardt sparkle in wins for the Melbourne Stars and Adelaide Strikers.

item.title: Rodney Neville Watkins jailed for historic sexual abuse of four Perth schoolboys
item.description: A former Perth teacher who abused four schoolboys in the 1970s and 80s, in behaviour a District Court Judge described as "predatory", is jailed for 16 years.

item.title: Free concert in Melbourne CBD cancelled after overcrowding and safety concerns
item.description: A free concert scheduled in Melbourne's Fed Square was cancelled at the last minute on Friday night, with organisers citing overcrowding.

item.title: More than 11,000 customers lose power as storms with spectacular lightning hit south-east Queensland
item.description: An intense storm cell with dramatic lightning moves over the Brisbane area, delaying Friday evening commuters with heavy rain, strong winds and large hail.

item.title: Corey Rocchiccioli stars as WA beats Queensland in one-wicket Sheffield Shield thriller
item.description: Spinner Corey Rocchiccioli and No. 11 Cameron Gannon combine for a 23-run final wicket stand to deliver Western Australia a last-gasp Sheffield Shield victory over Queensland.

item.title: Court finds 'pollutant' BHP liable over deadly Brazilian dam collapse
item.description: A British court has ruled mining giant BHP liable for a deadly dam collapse in Brazil a decade ago, which sparked one of the world's largest environmental disasters on record.

item.title: Bus crash in Sweden's capital Stockholm causes several casualties
item.description: At least three people have died and another three have been injured after an empty double-decker bus crashed into a bus stop.

item.title: Trump's BBC and Epstein sagas dominate attention as international relations are rewritten
item.description: As what's happening in Trump's America dominates our attention there is a lot going on, mostly involving everyone else around the world refashioning their politics in an environment that has never seemed more uncertain.

item.title: Hair loss drug finasteride causing psychological side effects in some men
item.description: A vocal minority of finasteride users speak out about the long-lasting mental side effects of the hair loss drug, as telehealth ads for the medication surge on social media.

item.title: The Paris conundrum at the heart of the Coalition's net zero backflip
item.description: Liberal shadow cabinet members landed on a plan that has left many inside and outside the party bewildered and confused.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein emails show he kept tabs on Donald Trump for years
item.description: A trove of Jeffrey Epstein emails released this week reveals his preoccupation with US President Donald Trump in the years before Epstein's death.

item.title: Andrew Forrest is betting on renewable energy in Queensland's coal heartland
item.description: At a wind farm in central Queensland, the billionaire backer and the local boilermaker offer a glimpse into how the energy transition is reshaping regional communities.

item.title: Financial markets meltdown fears spread as US interest rate cut hopes fade
item.description: Markets are heading south over fears about the US economy and interest rates not falling. Analysts fear mortgage holders and superannuates are in the firing line.

item.title: Health star ratings likely to become mandatory as food industry misses 70pc target
item.description: Health ministers will meet next year and decide whether or not to make the system mandatory for all packaged food, something public health experts say is overdue.

item.title: After tireless advocacy and a dark history, Australia has a treaty with its First Peoples
item.description: Aunty Thelma lived through the mission era, stolen children and forced assimilation. As she witnessed the signing of the country's first treaty, her thoughts were on those who came before.

item.title: As the social media ban sets in, how do you decide what TV to let your kids watch?
item.description: We have navigated this new path of "what to watch/what to censor/what to allow" with stumbling footsteps. I'd love to tell you we have been perfectly consistent. We have not.

item.title: Jannik Sinner wary of Alex de Minaur ahead of ATP Finals semis
item.description: Reigning champion Jannik Sinner says he will need to produce his best tennis to get past Alex de Minaur in the semis at the season-ending ATP Finals.

item.title: Football coach Zia Younan found quietly playing in Melbourne suburbs despite FIFA ban for match-fixing
item.description: A corrupt coach who was banned for life by the world football governing body for match-fixing has been quietly playing for clubs in suburban Melbourne.

item.title: Ewens Ponds set to reopen for public snorkelling after environmental concerns prompted closure
item.description: A date is set for snorkellers to return Ewens Ponds on South Australia's Limestone Coast, after low water flows caused its closure to the public.

item.title: Man charged after pregnant woman struck by car and killed in Sydney
item.description: A 33-year-old woman and her unborn baby have died after being hit by a car that had been involved in a crash with another vehicle at the entrance of a car park in Hornsby.

item.title: Dolly Parton heads to Australian desert in unique exhibit celebrating rising art star Kaylene Whiskey
item.description: Dolly Parton has never stepped foot on the dry red dirt of Indulkana in remote South Australia, but she is a frequent visitor in the art of Kaylene Whisky, which celebrates sisterhood and strong women.

item.description: Guy Sebastian looks back on the good fortune he has enjoyed in his music career, with the release of his 10th studio album, 100 Times Around the Sun.

item.description: The request comes two days after thousands of documents were released that raised new questions about Mr Trump's relationship with Epstein.

item.title: Nearly half of women enrolled in Queensland homebirth program transferred to hospital, report finds
item.description: The homebirth program was launched at the Sunshine Coast University Hospital in July 2024, with 74 women enrolled in the service in its first 12 months.

item.description: A Cranbrook farmer says he feels like "the stuffing has been knocked out" of him after dozens of young pigs had been stolen from his property.

item.description: Former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh, 41, is standing trial over the 24-year-old's 2018 murder.

item.title: NT government flags new fines for owners whose pet crocodiles escape
item.description: Crocodile owners whose pets escape and have to be recaptured by rangers could soon face penalties starting at $300, plus another $100 for each hour the reptiles are on the loose.

item.title: Mona has lost $408 million since it opened in Tasmania but founder David Walsh doesn't mind
item.description: Hobart's landmark Museum of Old and New Art has racked up a staggering amount in losses since it opened in 2011, but founder David Walsh is still building.

item.description: After their homecoming Fed Square gig was cancelled over security fears, Amyl and the Sniffers put $5,000 behind the bar at seven live music venues around Melbourne.

item.description: Sanae Takaichi has been in the top job for less than a month, but her comments detailing what Japan could do if China invaded Taiwan has sparked a diplomatic war.

item.description: The only flashy thing at this golf club in regional Victoria is the community spirit, but it is enough for them to thrive.

item.description: Hundreds of food products, including beef and oranges, are now exempted from US trade tariffs, according to an executive order signed by President Donald Trump on Friday.

item.description: Macdonald Valley Public School may be tiny, but it has proven to be an unshakeable fixture in its small NSW community.

item.title: Man jailed for stealing signed print of Banksy's Girl with Balloon painting worth $544,000
item.description: The Grove Gallery in London was showcasing a collection of 13 Banksy pieces worth about £1.5 million ($3 million) when the iconic print was stolen.

item.description: Hit hard by last weekend's loss to Italy, the Wallabies are desperate to rebound when they face Ireland in Dublin on Sunday morning.

item.description: The fragile ceasefire in Gaza has now been in place for five weeks. Here is what has changed, what has not, and where things currently stand.

item.description: Australia's hopes of a favourable draw for next year's World Cup take a hit with a disappointing 1-0 loss to Venezuela in Texas.

item.title: The 'gun' shearer still setting a cracking pace at 85
item.description: Australian shearing legend John Harris has returned to a central Victorian woolshed for the 75th year.

item.description: From December 1, specialist general practitioners will have the ability to diagnose adults with ADHD and prescribe medication, in an Australian first.

item.description: The Northern Territory has some of the highest rates of diabetes globally, with health professionals warning that the cost of living is making it harder for those living in remote communities to access a nutritious diet.

item.description: The US president added that he also planned to raise the issue with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.description: Australian quick Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of the opening Ashes Test match against England in Perth with a hamstring injury.

item.description: Alex de Minaur falls to Jannik Sinner for the 13th straight time, as the Italian advances to the final of the season-ending championship for the third consecutive year.

item.description: Kmart has recalled four coloured sand products over concerns of asbestos contamination, prompting the ACT education department to close dozens more schools.

item.title: Bail denied to teen accused of causing crash that killed pregnant woman and unborn child
item.description: The 19-year-old accused of causing a crash at Hornsby on Friday night that claimed the life of a pregnant woman and her unborn child is denied bail.

item.title: Government considers dramatic intervention to save Tomago smelter
item.description: The federal government is considering a power-purchase agreement with Tomago to supply electricity at a stable price, after warnings the smelter may need to close because of rising power costs.

item.title: Former MP Nick Dametto declares victory in Townsville mayoral by-election
item.description: Nick Dametto, a former Queensland MP, has won 61 per cent of the votes counted, succeeding in his campaign to become Townsville's next mayor.

item.title: Coalition plans to strip climate from energy operator's objectives
item.description: Emissions reduction would no longer be an objective of Australia's energy operator under a Coalition plan endorsed by the Nationals and Liberals, prioritising affordability and reliability over climate.

item.title: Calls for federal government to help 'stranded Australians' waiting in hospital for aged care bed
item.description: About 1,000 people are waiting in Queensland public hospitals for more appropriate care, such as a place in aged care, with infrastructure failing to keep up with the need.

item.title: More than 90 patients stuck in Tasmanian hospitals waiting for aged care or NDIS support
item.description: More than 90 Tasmanians who have been medically cleared to leave hospital are not able to because they are waiting for an aged care place or NDIS support. Premier Jeremy Rockliff says it's "not good enough" and is calling on the federal government to increase hospital funding.

item.title: ACT to close 69 schools as more sand products recalled amid asbestos concerns
item.description: The ACT will close more schools after additional coloured sand products were recalled by Kmart and Target, while the schools that were shut on Friday will reopen on Monday.

item.title: From 'female Donald Trump' to 'Wacky' Marjorie — how Taylor Greene's alliance with the president crumbled
item.description: Once considered one of Donald Trump's most loyal soldiers, Marjorie Taylor Greene has found herself an outcast of the MAGA firm.

item.title: Renegades down Stars by four wickets as Devine sends down stunner in Scorchers win
item.description: The Renegades get the better of the Stars in the Melbourne derby, while Sophie Devine bowls one of the balls of the season in the Scorchers' defeat of the Strikers.

item.title: Zac Lomax released by Eels for 'opportunities outside NRL', fuelling speculation of R360 switch
item.description: Parramatta star Zac Lomax is released from the final three years of his NRL contract, fuelling speculation of a move to breakaway rugby competition R360.

item.title: Islam Makhachev claims UFC welterweight belt with dominant win over Jack Della Maddalena
item.description: Jack Della Maddalena was confident he could fight his way out of Islam Makhachev's grappling prowess, but it wasn't the case in front of a packed New York crowd.

item.title: Energy chiefs say net zero 'irreversible' even though bills unlikely to fall 'for a decade'
item.description: Amid swirling debate among conservative politicians over decarbonisation, energy bosses have warned against turning away from net zero despite cost pressures.

item.title: This week in history quiz: Do you know what Holden made before cars? Test yourself
item.description: Metallica's unusual gig, John Lennon's murder and a king's abdication — how well do you know this week in history?

item.title: Ambulance response times sluggish despite Tasmanian ramping 'ban' promise
item.description: The Tasmanian government's "ban" on ambulance ramping was announced with much fanfare in 2024 — but there has been no effect on ambulance response times, and patients are still facing long waits in hospital emergency departments.

item.title: Why 'not just living for the weekend' may be a social media trend for good
item.description: Emma Dickeson says her "school night" adventures are about devoting time and attention to the things that energise you.

item.title: Family demand justice for Ukrainian journalist tortured in Russia
item.description: Family and former colleagues of a Ukrainian journalist who was captured by Russian forces and tortured are determined to do everything they can to ensure those who contributed to her death are held responsible.

item.title: Laos methanol poisoning survivor 'turning grief into action'
item.description: A survivor of last year's Laos mass methanol poisoning has started a campaign to educate travellers on the dangers of the toxic form of alcohol.

item.title: Vang Vieng backpacker hostel implicated in Laos methanol deaths set to reopen
item.description: The Laos hostel accused of serving alcohol contaminated with methanol that killed six people — including two young Australian women — last November is set to reopen.

item.title: Palestinians fear 'nothing can be done' about Israeli military operation in West Bank refugee camps
item.description: After Palestinians were expelled from three refugee camps in the Israeli occupied West Bank this year, some fear a new ceasefire in Gaza could prompt Israel to expand its operations in the area once more.

item.title: Tony Abbott admits he was fighting the urge to thump journalist in 2011 interview
item.description: In 2011, Tony Abbott was questioned over his use of the phrase "shit happens" when discussing the death of an Australian soldier in Afghanistan. Instead of responding, he stared at the journalist, fighting the urge to thump him.

item.title: The strange macho appeal of fossil fuels in a world struggling to reach net zero
item.description: The strange macho appeal of fossilised vegetation means that 30 years of annual United Nations meetings to stop the planet heating any more have been a bust.

item.title: Indian counterterrorism agency arrests alleged co-conspirator in Red Fort suicide bombing
item.description: India's National Investigation Agency says two men behind last week's deadly car blast in Delhi were from Kashmir, a region that has been a source of tension between India and Pakistan.

item.title: WA testing lab inundated by families' and retailers' concerns about asbestos-contaminated sand
item.description: Concerned families and retailers are inundating a materials testing laboratory with enquiries, since news broke that asbestos had been detected in decorative and coloured sand for children.

item.title: Sussan Ley scrabbling to retain leadership after net zero capitulation puts one advantage at risk
item.description: It was only a week ago that the moderates in the Liberal Party were flexing their muscle privately (and some publicly), threatening a divorce with the Nationals and to walk the plank if net zero was dumped. Neither threat ever materialised.

item.title: Operational dates for Northern Water project pushed out by several years
item.description: Completion of the South Australian government’s Northern Water desalination plant and water pipeline is now forecast to occur in 2032.

item.title: Numbers suggest England's Ashes preparation does not make a difference
item.description: Has England compromised its pre-Ashes preparation by playing only one three-day warm-up match against its own reserve team before the first Test in Perth? The numbers say no.

item.title: Government auditors suspected lab was conducting shonky tests on infrastructure projects
item.description: Across the country, labs conduct crucial testing on construction materials used for roads infrastructure projects. But not all are doing it properly, according to audit documents obtained exclusively by the ABC.

item.title: Doorbell footage shows aftermath of Waterloo police death in custody
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Police mental health unit under the spotlight after the deaths of 10 people
item.description: An officer who headed the NSW Police unit training the force in mental health responses once committed misconduct in a case where a mentally ill man was fatally shot by police.

item.title: Sam Kerr rested as Chelsea drops Women's Super League points
item.description: English champs Chelsea decide to rest Sam Kerr for their WSL clash against Liverpool but appear to pay the price with a 1-1 slip-up at Liverpool.

item.title: Australians with disability tell their stories for International Day of People with Disability 2025
item.description: The ABC is featuring stories by and about people with disability leading up to and following December 3, the International Day of People with Disability.

item.title: Residents in battle with nearby metal recycler business due to zoning issue
item.description: Ararat locals in Western Victoria say some face pollution from a nearby scrap metal recycler due to a zoning irregularity.

item.title: Federal politics live: Moderates rally behind Ley's leadership as Albanese labels Liberal energy policy 'nonsensical'
item.description: Sussan Ley says she is not worried her leadership is on the rocks after a bumpy week for the opposition. Follow live.

item.title: Police seize record number of bladed weapons amid knife crime concerns
item.description: Police have confiscated more than 15,000 bladed weapons this year amid heightened community concern over knife crime.

item.title: Maya Joint's fighting qualities praised in Billie Jean King Cup win over Brazil
item.description: Australia advances to the qualifying stage of the Billie Jean King Cup after Maya Joint and Kimberly Birrell dug deep to defeat Brazil and top their group.

item.title: Dan Tehan grilled on plan for coal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Live updates: Wall Street ends mixed after volatile session and ASX set to slip further
item.description: Wall Street has ended a volatile session with mixed results, while the ASX slide is expected to continue today. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Locals brace for timber industry job losses amid creation of Great Koala National Park
item.description: A third of Herons Creek’s population on the NSW mid north coast faces possible redundancy as the timber mill struggles to survive the logging moratorium to create the Great Koala National Park.

item.title: Jannik Sinner beats Carlos Alcaraz in ATP Finals in latest Sincaraz rivalry
item.description: Jannik Sinner has defeated world number one Carlos Alcaraz 7-6 (4), 7-5 in the ATP Finals title decider, defending his crown.

item.title: 'There is an alternative way to reduce emissions than net zero': Littleproud
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Journey times decrease under Brisbane's new bus timetable
item.description: The biggest change to Brisbane's bus network came into effect in June. Here's how people have been using buses since then.

item.title: Unique rehabilitation program offers alternative to prison system
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Groote Eylandt's unique rehabilitation program offers alternative to NT prison system amid record incarceration rates
item.description: As the NT's prison population soars to new highs, Anindilyakwa elders on Groote Eylandt are delivering a unique rehabilitation program that provides participants with physical and psycho-educational programs, as well as new skills and employment opportunities.

item.title: Esperance community fights for more change, a decade on from deadly bushfires
item.description: A decade on from bushfires that claimed four lives, this community says not enough has been done to ensure they are safe.

item.title: New York Jets NFL player Kris Boyd shot in Manhattan
item.description: New York Jets cornerback Kris Boyd has been critically injured in a shooting in mid-town Manhattan.

item.title: German auction house cancels sale of Holocaust artefacts after backlash
item.description: The auction titled The System of Terror had more than 600 items, including letters written by the prisoners. A group of holocaust survivors had called for the auction to be cancelled.

item.title: Iran begins cloud seeding to induce rain as it faces worst drought in decades
item.description: Cloud seeding involves spraying particles such as silver iodide and salt into clouds from aircraft to trigger rain.

item.title: Calls for greater education as growers in WA's south-west brace for polyphagous shot-hole borer
item.description: Growers in this major food bowl are nervous for their future, as the state focuses its shot-hole borer efforts on outer-Perth.

item.title: South Africa beat India by 30 runs in low-scoring first Test boilover
item.description: South Africa upsets India on a turning pitch at Eden Gardens, with spinner Simon Harmer taking eight wickets in a man-of-the-match performance for the World Test Champions.

item.title: These young men escaped restless boredom that led to chaos and crime
item.description: Nye was getting into trouble and making bad choices when he was handed a lifeline that helped him turn things around.

item.title: Two men allegedly run over during road-rage incident near Forster
item.description: Two men are in hospital with serious injuries after an alleged road-rage incident near Forster on the NSW Mid North Coast. A teenager travelling with the men was also injured when he tried to help.

item.title: This week in history quiz: Step back in time with these questions from the archive
item.description: The Velvet Revolution, an Australian rock star's legacy and the youngest ever Saturday Night Live host — do you recognise these events from Novembers past?

item.title: Koala mapping near Mudgee discovers strong population and ideal habitat
item.description: Scientists mapping koala habitat in the NSW central west find it is larger than previously thought, but concerns remain over expansion plans at a nearby coal mine.

item.title: Ireland celebrates after Troy Parrott secures last-second World Cup qualifier victory over Hungary
item.description: Ireland keeps its hopes alive of making the World Cup finals for the first time since 2002 with a stunning comeback.

item.title: Preferred buyer announced for disability employment provider Bedford
item.description: The federal health minister says the jobs of "hundreds and hundreds of South Australians who live with a disability" have been secured, as The Disability Trust is named as the preferred buyer to take over Bedford's supported employment and learning and experience programs.

item.title: When is the 2025 AFL draft? Here's your guide to bidding, trades and the official pick order
item.description: Another AFL draft has arrived, offering dozens of teenage footballers the chance to realise their dreams. Here is everything you need to know.

item.title: From Blue Poles to Gina Rinehart, the most controversial artworks in Australia
item.description: Art can stir strong feelings in people, both good and bad. These artworks fell in the latter, provoking great controversy in Australia, and telling us a lot about who we are as a nation.

item.title: Australian golfers qualify for LPGA Tour Championship as Swede Linn Grant wins The Annika
item.description: Swede Linn Grant has won The Annika on the LPGA Tour, finishing the tournament 19 under par for a three-stroke victory.

item.title: Protesters in Mexico City attacked police with stones, fireworks, sticks and chains.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gen Z protests in Mexico City brings thousands out against crime and corruption
item.description: The demonstration was mostly peaceful but ended with some young people clashing with the police.

item.title: Sam Konstas picked to open for Prime Minister's XI against England in Canberra
item.description: Sam Konstas will return to the scene where he made his case for Test selection last summer, with the axed opener given a chance to face England with the Prime Minister's XI.

item.title: Paralympic gold medal winner Paige Greco dies, aged 28
item.description: The family of Australian Paralympic gold medallist Paige Greco confirms she has died aged 28.

item.title: China's seafood import rules behind a partial closure of Tasmania's rock lobster fishery
item.description: The Tasmanian government closed two zones within the state's rock lobster fishery just hours after the commercial season opened. The closure is in response to concerns about an antibiotic being used by salmon companies and the rock lobster industry's reputation in overseas markets.

item.title: Why the ACT has gone further than other jurisdictions in closing schools over coloured sand asbestos concerns
item.description: The ACT has closed 69 schools over the coloured sand asbestos scare. Why is it the only jurisdiction to do so?

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann gets full forensic copy of Toowoomba rape accuser's phone after court order
item.description: A judge rules in favour of Mr Lehrmann, who has been seeking a full copy of the woman's phone for several months.

item.title: US flagship aircraft carrier arrives in Caribbean as part of massive military build-up
item.description: Following the arrival of a 100,000 tonne warship in the Caribbean, as part of a massive military build-up, President Donald Trump has hinted that the US "may be having some discussions" with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
